H0.text: What are the only two types of mammal that can lay eggs. Kangaroos

H1.text: What are the only two types of mammal that can lay eggs. Sloths

H2.text: What are the only two types of mammal that can lay eggs. Armadillos

H3.text: What are the only two types of mammal that can lay eggs. Platypi

A6.text: Monotremes are the only mammals still in existence which lay eggs, rather than bearing live young.

A7.text: The five extant monotreme species are the platypus and the four species of echidnas.

A8.text: The four extant species of echidnas and the platypus are the only living mammals that lay eggs and the only surviving members of the order Monotremata.
